title: SoC RTVF 360-0-25 Topics in Media Writing

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Learning objectives: In this
course, students will learn to use improvisation as a tool to generate ideas, develop written material, and enrich a writing practice. Students
will learn core tenets of improv performance as developed in Chicago-based theaters, and will have the chance to test experimental techniques based in physical theatre, clown, and Neo-Futurism.
Through in-class performance exercises, this course will explore how to build character, dialogue, and environment
through improv, as well as how to refine scenes and develop story structure in an existing script.
Fostering an atmosphere of collaboration and spontaneity, students will learn how improvisational techniques can be applied professionally
in a writer's room setting.


Evaluation method: Students will be graded on participation, short
writing assignments, written response to least one recommended show, and a final project: the substantial progress (30 to 40 pages) or completion of an original
play, screenplay, or teleplay.


Class materials: Napier, Mick. Improvise: Scene from the Inside
Out. Meriwether Publishing Ltd: Second Edition. ISBN-13: 978-1566081986

Additional weekly handouts and readings (TBD) will be distributed in class and available via CANVAS.
